content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Locate a hotel in Rome with a good rating (7 or above) that offers free cancellation and breakfast included, for a three-night stay from May 28 to May 31, 2026, for two adults.  Please interact with https://www.booking.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The task requires searching for hotels in Rome. The next necessary action is to input "Rome" as the destination in the "Where are you going?" textbox to start the search.
Action: Type [14]; Rome
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is currently set to September and October 2025, but the desired check-in and check-out dates are May 28 to May 31, 2026. I need to keep advancing the calendar to reach May 2026.
Action: Click [18]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still need to advance the calendar, as I am only at November 2025 and need to reach May 2026 to set up the correct check-in and check-out dates.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.18
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now on November and December 2025. I still need to advance several more months to reach May 2026.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.19
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is now at January 2026 but I need to reach May 2026. I should continue navigating forward.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows January and February 2026, but I need to select May 2026. I should continue to navigate to the next months until I reach May.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.22
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar currently displays February and March 2026. I need to navigate further ahead to reach May 2026 for the check-in and check-out date selection.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.24
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays March and April 2026. I need to go forward one more time to bring up May 2026 in order to select the required dates for the stay (May 28 to May 31, 2026).
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.26
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows May 2026. I can select May 28 (check-in) and May 31 (check-out) for the desired three-night stay.
Action: Click [87]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The check-in date (May 28, 2026) is selected. Next, I need to select the check-out date, which should be May 31, 2026, to meet the required three-night stay.
Action: Click [90]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The dates for the stay (May 28 to May 31, 2026) and the number of adults are correctly set. The next step is to filter for hotels with free cancellation and breakfast included, as well as a good rating. I see "Breakfast included" and "Free cancellation" among the available filters on the left sidebar.
Action: Click [111]   // "Breakfast included"
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: The "Breakfast included" filter is likely below the visible section of the sidebar, as only the first few filters are showing. I need to scroll down within the filter sidebar to reveal more filter options, including "Breakfast included" and "Free cancellation."
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current view shows property type filters (e.g., Hotels, Bed and Breakfasts, Apartments) but not yet "Free cancellation" or "Breakfast included". I need to continue scrolling down in the sidebar to find these options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The filters visible are for "Parking options," "Beach Access," and the start of "Facilities" (where "Restaurant" is visible). The needed filters ("Free cancellation" and "Breakfast included") are likely further down in the Facilities section. I need to scroll down further to access these options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible section of the sidebar is showing facilities and room options, but the needed "Free cancellation" and "Breakfast included" filters do not appear. There is a "Show all 11" button within the Facilities section which may expand additional options, potentially revealing the needed filters.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The full facilities list is now expanded, but there are still no visible options for "Free cancellation" or "Breakfast included." Since these are specific booking conditions rather than facilities, they might be further down the sidebar or in a different filter section. I need to scroll further down the sidebar.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.62
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The sidebar now includes review score filters, which will help select hotels with a good rating (7+ and above). However, specific booking condition filters like "Free cancellation" and "Breakfast included" are still not visible, likely positioned further down. I should keep scrolling down to locate them.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.65
